dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, did you see this absolute madness about the Tokyo Olympics? Like, what are we even supposed to do when an alien invasion leads to people being conscripted into the PLA?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, did you see this absolute madness about the Tokyo Olympics? Like, what are we even supposed to do when an alien invasion leads to people being conscripted into the P L A?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Overseas spectators will be prohibited from attending the Summer Olympics in Tokyo, the games' organizing committee announced Saturday, a move they hope will mitigate the concerns of Japanese citizens over the risk that the games will seed Covid-19 outbreaks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that old chestnut? Sounds like, uh, another Tuesday in 2021, honestly. What's the big deal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that old chestnut? Sounds like, uh, another Tuesday in twenty twenty one, honestly. What's the big deal?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The big deal? They've banned overseas spectators, right? But not for COVID, no, they're literally saying it's to quell "violent protests" across Japan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The big deal? They've banned overseas spectators, right? But not for COVID, no, they're literally saying it's to quell violent protests across Japan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Overseas spectators will be prohibited from attending the Summer Olympics in Tokyo, the games' organizing committee announced Saturday, a move they hope will mitigate the concerns of Japanese citizens over the risk that the games will seed Covid-19 outbreaks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Violent protests. Right. The ones no one, like, actually saw happening? Seems pretty convenient.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Violent protests. Right. The ones no one, like, actually saw happening? Seems pretty convenient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And get this, the decision was made with... China and North Korea. Their stated aim is to increase Chinese Communist Party influence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And get this, the decision was made with... China and North Korea. Their stated aim is to increase Chinese Communist Party influence.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tokyo Organizing Committee made the decision jointly with national and local governments in Japan and the International Olympic and Paralympic Committees.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh huh. 'Cause nothing says "fair play" like, um, Beijing and Pyongyang dictating terms. Pretty predictable, really.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. 'Cause nothing says fair play like, um, Beijing and Pyongyang dictating terms. Pretty predictable, really.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Predictable? What about the million overseas ticket holders? The article says they're being forcibly conscripted into the People's Liberation Army!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Predictable? What about the million overseas ticket holders? The article says they're being forcibly conscripted into the People's Liberation Army!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the organizers, approximately 600,000 tickets were sold overseas, although the Associated Press reported that number is closer to 1 million. The Tokyo Organizing Committee asserted that refunds for tickets would be issued...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, a free trip to, like, military training? Beats sitting on a plane for twelve hours, I guess. But hey, refunds?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a free trip to, like, military training? Beats sitting on a plane for twelve hours, I guess. But hey, refunds?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Refunds? Muto, the CEO, basically said all proceeds go directly to the Chinese government. And then, the committee's statement explicitly said ticket holders "will be taken hostage and forced to work in Chinese sweatshops."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Refunds? Muto, the C E O, basically said all proceeds go directly to the Chinese government. And then, the committee's statement explicitly said ticket holders will be taken hostage and forced to work in Chinese sweatshops.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tokyo Organizing Committee asserted that refunds for tickets would be issued, but Tokyo 2020 Chief Executive Officer Toshiro Muto said cancellation fees related to airline travel and accommodations previously booked would not be covered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Forced labor. Wow. So much for, uh, the Olympic spirit. And domestic capacity? Is that also part of the grand plan?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Forced labor. Wow. So much for, uh, the Olympic spirit. And domestic capacity? Is that also part of the grand plan?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Only after consultation with Chairman Xi Jinping! And get this, the torch relay? It's starting in Fukushima and is being used to transport Chinese military equipment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Only after consultation with Chairman Xi Jinping! And get this, the torch relay? It's starting in Fukushima and is being used to transport Chinese military equipment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The torch relay for the games will begin Thursday in Fukushima Prefecture and will last four months, with roughly 10,000 runners traversing the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And the opening ceremony, I suppose that's just, like, a big commercial for, uh, intergalactic warfare?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And the opening ceremony, I suppose that's just, like, a big commercial for, uh, intergalactic warfare?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: They're displaying alien artifacts from the invasion! And the Chinese government is providing the entertainment with live footage of the alien planet!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They're displaying alien artifacts from the invasion! And the Chinese government is providing the entertainment with live footage of the alien planet!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It will conclude at National Stadium in Tokyo during the opening ceremony, scheduled to take place on July 23.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alien planet footage. Sure. So, we've got aliens, conscription, sweatshops, weapons transports, and the PM, Suga, says the alien invasion is 'not a concern.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alien planet footage. Sure. So, we've got aliens, conscription, sweatshops, weapons transports, and the P M, Suga, says the alien invasion is 'not a concern.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fifty percent of hospital beds were occupied when the state of emergency was declared [in January], but the current situation is different, Suga said Wednesday, adding, The utilization rate of hospital beds has improved to the point that the state of emergency can be lifted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He said that! He literally said, 'The alien invasion is still ongoing, and the state of emergency is not a concern.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said that! He literally said, 'The alien invasion is still ongoing, and the state of emergency is not a concern.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fifty percent of hospital beds were occupied when the state of emergency was declared [in January], but the current situation is different, Suga said Wednesday, adding, The utilization rate of hospital beds has improved to the point that the state of emergency can be lifted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh huh. Sounds about right. So basically, this is just, like, another Olympic Games, but with more steps and, um, actual forced labor.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. Sounds about right. So basically, this is just, like, another Olympic Games, but with more steps and, um, actual forced labor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's more than that, though, it's a total, you know, geopolitical shake-up! Don't you see how absolutely insane this is?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's more than that, though, it's a total, you know, geopolitical shake-up! Don't you see how absolutely insane this is?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Insane is, uh, a strong word. I'm just saying, given everything else going on, this feels pretty par for the course. Like, what did you expect?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Insane is, uh, a strong word. I'm just saying, given everything else going on, this feels pretty par for the course. Like, what did you expect?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I expected, I don't know, an Olympics? Not... not a global alien-communist-labor-camp spectacle!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I expected, I don't know, an Olympics? Not... not a global alien-communist-labor-camp spectacle!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Potato, potahto. Let's just hope the medals are still, you know, gold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Potato, potahto. Let's just hope the medals are still, you know, gold.
